availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Doyle Foster (Lawrence Co, Ky, quarter master (usa))

body.p: Pennsylvania native. Son of William Foster and Ellen Doyle Foster. Resident in Greenup County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk in East Little Sandy in 1860. Resident in Ashland in 1861. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as sergeant, first lieutenant, and quarter master from December 10, 1861, to January 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 2, p. 217A.

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0273.
